newsitem.title: NORWAY: Phillips says Ekofisk repairs may take more time.
newsitem.headline: Phillips says Ekofisk repairs may take more time.

text.p: Phillips Petroleum said on Wednesday repair work at the North Sea Ekofisk oilfield may take longer than first thought.
Earlier a Phillips' spokesman said the company hoped to restart the 350,000 barrel per day field on Thursday after it was shut down on Tuesday following a gas leak in an oil pipeline.
"Work is progressing but it could take longer than two days," the spokesman said. "We should know more tomorrow (Thursday) morning."
Oil from third party fields -- British Petroleum's Gyda and Ula and Amoco's Valhall and Hod -- and the Statpipe gas line continued to flow, he said.
Traders said the company had declared force majeure on Ekofisk cargoes loading at Britain's Seal Sands terminal, to which the crude is piped.
